ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to critically evaluate primary literature
Ability to critically read scientific papers.
I really learned how to critically analyze subjects I am not familiar with. I learned to humbly and confidently speak to my understanding and questions of a study.
how to critically analyze various publications

Paper reading and critical thinking/critical analysis of presented data and models were the main things I developed, with a side effect of me learning a lot about techniques, approaches, and fields of research I wasn't especially familiar with.
I learned a lot about the world of RNA that I did not know before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Possibly the range of paper topics could be expanded
I think the course was great.
strengths: great professor involvement and steady cycle of classes weaknesses: not enough support for those outside the field
strengths: in-depth dicussions of papers, critiquing publications weaknesses: no variety of paper topics covered
I think writing paper summaries before class would be a useful way to make sure everyone comes to class prepared.

As the general message I loved this course. Just getting together to talk about interesting papers that aren't things I would necessarily read otherwise is fun, engaging, and makes me think about things in slightly new ways, which is great going into a grad program where I'm trying to do new an innovative research. Journal clubbing is a hard format to improve in some ways. Maybe having students be responsible for some sections of papers would be useful in some instances, where technical details of an experiment schema make it less likely that a read through will give enough info and can lead to confusion.
I did not like having multiple instructors because I felt some were better than others.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Most definitely! Great class to help you learn how to critically read papers
Yes. It will help students who are not used to reading scientific papers.
Yes I would. I would suggest having taken biochem or genetics. As I have not it was quite difficult.

Yes, we were required to go over papers in much more detail compared with other classes. Writing our own reviews for a paper was a helpful assignment, and helped improve my understanding of what is required to write a manuscript
Yes!
I absolutely would.
I would. I thought it was interesting to read papers ranging from fundamental to modern day.
